meanings.definition: To attract or entice someone or something to go somewhere or do something by offering some form of reward or incentive.
meanings.sent1: The shiny object lured the cat out of hiding.
meanings.sent2: The promise of a treat lured the dog into the yard.
meanings.sent3: The clever mouse lured the cheese into the trap.
meanings.sent4: The colorful flowers lured the butterflies to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The sound of laughter lured her to join the fun.

meanings.definition: To tempt or persuade someone to do something by using deception or trickery.
meanings.sent1: The con artist lured the unsuspecting victim into a scam.
meanings.sent2: The false advertisement lured customers to buy the product.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fox lured the chickens away from the coop.
meanings.sent4: The fake treasure map lured the treasure hunters into a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick lured the audience into believing the impossible.
